thread.title: Mora hopes JDT won’t be left in the cold against Gamba
thread.title_full: Mora hopes JDT won’t be left in the cold against Gamba

author: MOHD FARHAAN SHAH
title: Mora hopes JDT won’t be left in the cold against Gamba
text:
by Johor Darul Ta' 
JOHOR BARU: Super League champions Johor Darul Tazim (JDT) are bracing themselves for a chilly experience in Osaka. 
The Southern Tigers, bidding to become the first Malaysian team to qualify for the AFC Champions League (ACL), are leaving no stone unturned ahead of their crucial playoff against J1 League side Gamba Osaka at the Suita City Football Stadium in Osaka on Tuesday (6pm Malaysian time). 
JDT head coach Benjamin Mora feels that the cold weather (about 12C) could prove decisive and added that it was important for his players to quickly adapt to the conditions in Osaka. 
The weather in Japan is very different than in Malaysia. We need to be in Osaka at least three days in advance to acclimatise to the cold conditions there. 
“This will allow the players more time to adapt to the new playing environment,” said Bora before departing to Japan via Singapores Changi Airport yesterday. 
The Mexican, who replaced Argentine Mario Gomez last month, said that the players have been in high spirits since the hard-fought 5-4 sudden death penalty shootout win over Thailands Bangkok United in the preliminary stage two on Jan 31. 
“” 
JDT, the 2015 AFC Cup champions, will be counting on their new Argentine signings – Gonzalo Cabrera and Brian Ferreira to get the goals while Jeronimo Barrales is out on suspension.
